title: Motivation Model-Based Instructional Design for Advanced Nursing Practice Education

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: Small-group real-time online training for working nurse learners in a BYOD environment.

learning_goals: Learners can enhance learning motivation by over 20% through instructional design applying the ARCS model.
Learners analyze complex clinical cases using self-directed learning strategies.

Applying creative problem-solving techniques (brainstorming, 5Why analysis), learners must develop practical strategies for three nursing scenarios (e.g., patient complaints, resource shortages, communication barriers) within one week, achieve an average ≥3/4 on peer/teacher rubric feedback.

resources: Zoom account and meeting room setup

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
